job_description.0:
About the job
            
 
About RevolutPeople deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of aweso﻿me products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 35+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.  As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. We've been officially certified as a Great Place to Work™ in recognition of our outstanding employee experience! So far, we have 7,500+﻿ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.About The RoleOn the Revolut rocket ship, there aren't many teams more important than Product. To put it simply: there’s no lift off without these guys. Frankly, there’s no rocket. Every one of our award-winning features started here and all our future ones will too 🏆The team’s scope is wide, leading on the integration of engineering, data science, operations, and design. But when it comes to our vision of reinventing financial services, they’re laser focused 🔫Product Owners at Revolut hold the helm 🚢 If you join the Dream Team, you’ll have sole responsibility over the roadmap of your product. Total ownership. The people, the profit, the loss, all in your hands. It’s fast paced. Very much so. But if you can manage all that - and bring with it a bottle full of entrepreneurial passion - then you’re probably the captain we’re looking for ⚓To find out more about our recent launch of Rev10 and hear from some of the people you will be working with, check out this video!What You’ll Be Doing Completely owning and building our Crypto Exchange product, increasing the number of tokens tradable in the application and providing the tools retail users expect from exchangesSetting your team's goals, success metrics, and roadmap to align with Revolut’s mission and drive maximum impact based on data analysis, market research, and company strategyWorking with our Core Crypto team to expand and improve our suite of crypto products, including deposits, withdrawals, and staking, making them more accessible for our retail usersWorking closely with Design and UX Research to define the customer journey and create an amazing user experienceLiaising with Engineering to ensure effective delivery of the productCollaborating with other stakeholders, such as Product Marketing, Legal, and Product Strategy
What You'll Need 2-3 years of experience building a crypto exchange platform2+ years of proven success building the core functionality of trading products1+ years of experience in managing people (Product Owners at Revolut directly manage Engineering, Operations, and Design)Experience managing a team of product owners and delivering successful products from 0-1A STEM backgroundOutstanding verbal and written communication skillsAn eye for great UX/UI and a good understanding of design best practicesAn understanding of technical backend with integrations and APIsHigh analytical acumen along with strong business sense that guides ROI based prioritisationExperience formulating and driving a focused product vision, owning the narrative with leadership, users, and partnersA bias to action and bootstrapping major projects, never hesitating to roll up your sleeves and be hands onA readiness to provide insight and deliver measurable results for sophisticated products under ambiguous situations in a fast-paced environment
Nice to have Experience in Trading/Quant
Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.Refer to our Data Privacy Statement for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

To put it simply: there’s no lift off without these guys. Frankly, there’s no rocket. Total ownership. The people, the profit, the loss, all in your hands. It’s fast paced. Very much so. But if you can manage all that - and bring with it a bottle full of entrepreneurial passion - then you’re probably the captain we’re looking for ⚓To find out more about our recent launch of Rev10 and hear from some of the people you will be working with, check out this video!What You’ll Be Doing Completely owning and building our Crypto Exchange product, increasing the number of tokens tradable in the application and providing the tools retail users expect from exchangesSetting your team's goals, success metrics, and roadmap to align with Revolut’s mission and drive maximum impact based on data analysis, market research, and company strategyWorking with our Core Crypto team to expand and improve our suite of crypto products, including deposits, withdrawals, and staking, making them more accessible for our retail usersWorking closely with Design and UX Research to define the customer journey and create an amazing user experienceLiaising with Engineering to ensure effective delivery of the productCollaborating with other stakeholders, such as Product Marketing, Legal, and Product Strategy

job_description.9:
About the job
            
 
ASI Reisen ist eine der führenden Reiseplattformen für nachhaltige Aktiv- & Erlebnisreisen weltweit. Seit 1963 stehen wir als Familienunternehmen für Wertschätzung und Innovation im sanften Tourismus. Trotz unserer bald 60-jährigen Erfahrung leben wir eine dynamische Unternehmenskultur mit Start-up Mentalität. Mit unserem Team von 50 Mitarbeiter:innen im ASI Nest und unseren 300 Guides bieten wir rund 4.500 nachhaltige Abenteuerreisen in 100+ Ländern an. Hiking, Trekking, Bike, Alpine, Kanu und vieles mehr.Hast Du Lust die Zukunft des Reisens zu gestalten? Abseits von Kreuzfahrtschiffen und All-Inklusiv-Bunkern? Nachhaltig und auf Augenhöhe mit der lokalen Community? Dann bewirb Dich bei uns. job_description.10:
About the job
            
 
ASI Reisen ist eine der führenden Reiseplattformen für nachhaltige Aktiv- & Erlebnisreisen weltweit. Seit 1963 stehen wir als Familienunternehmen für Wertschätzung und Innovation im sanften Tourismus. Trotz unserer bald 60-jährigen Erfahrung leben wir eine dynamische Unternehmenskultur mit Start-up Mentalität. Mit unserem Team von 50 Mitarbeiter:innen im ASI Nest und unseren 300 Guides bieten wir rund 4.500 nachhaltige Abenteuerreisen in 100+ Ländern an. Wir bieten Arbeiten im mehrfach ausgezeichneten ASI Nest oder komplett remoteEin tolles und sympathisches Team mit der gleichen Leidenschaft für das Reisen wie duModerne Unternehmenskultur mit flacher Hierarchie und der Möglichkeit schnell Dinge umzusetzenLeistungsorientierte Entlohnung und ErfolgspartizipationJährliches Budget für die Teilnahme an unseren ReisenRegelmäßige Teamevents am Abend, Budget für Ausflüge und Aktivitäten in kleineren GruppenHöhenverstellbare Tische an jedem ArbeitsplatzDuschen zur Sportausübung auf dem Weg zur/weg von der Arbeit oder in der MittagspauseTischtennis & -fußball sowie Mitarbeiter:innengartenKostenlose Parkplätze direkt am FirmengeländeWöchentlich Yoga, Massagen, Obstkorb
Suchst Du eine herausfordernde Aufgabe mit Sinn? Werde Teil unseres Teams und gestalte mit uns die Zukunft des Reisemarktes. Abseits von Kreuzfahrtschiffen und All-Inclusive-Clubs, dafür auf Augenhöhe mit Land und Leuten.Sende Deinen Lebenslauf gerne gleich an jobs@asi.at. Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!
job_description.16:
About the job
            
 
Department: ProductEmployment Type: Full TimeLocation:  Kraków, PolandReporting To: Paweł KrajewskiCompensation: zł20,000 - zł25,000 / monthDescriptionAbout the role: Head of Product, VoluumCommerce Media Tech is seeking an experienced and strategic-minded Head of Product to join our dynamic team - Voluum. In this pivotal role, you will play a crucial part in defining and executing our product strategy for Voluum, leading and mentoring a team of product managers to better meet the evolving needs of our customers. It is the highest product role in Voluum.If you are a strategic thinker with a passion for leading product teams and shaping the future of advertising technology, we want to hear from you. Join us at Commerce Media Tech as our Head of Product and help us drive innovation, create value for our customers, and shape the future of digital advertising. Apply now to be part of our exciting journey!This position offers full remote work.About Company:Commerce Media Tech is a leading global provider of advertising technology solutions. Our flagship product, Voluum, is a cutting-edge advertising tracking and management platform trusted by top marketers and agencies worldwide. With a strong commitment to innovation and a customer-centric approach, Commerce Media Tech is at the forefront of the digital advertising industry, empowering businesses to optimize their marketing efforts.In November 2020, Commerce Media Tech was acquired by CentralNic Group (now Team Internet). Team Internet is a global company listed on the London Stock Exchange. Team Internet is an organization and corporation serving millions of web customers around the globe.Key Responsibilities Product Strategy: develop and articulate a clear and compelling product vision and strategy for Voluum, aligning it with Commerce Media Tech's overall direction. Team Leadership: lead, mentor, and inspire a team of product managers, fostering a culture of user-centricity, collaboration, and continuous improvement (currently you would work directly with three PMs, two designers and one researcher). Execution: drive the successful execution of the product roadmap, ensuring the timely delivery of high-quality value for our customers. Market Research: stay abreast of industry trends, competitive landscape, and customer feedback to identify opportunities for product improvements and innovation. Customer Focus: develop a deep understanding of customer needs and pain points, working closely with cross-functional teams to prioritize and deliver solutions that provide exceptional value. Cross-Functional Collaboration: collaborate with engineering, design, marketing, and other departments to ensure alignment and successful product launches. Product Analytics: define and track key product metrics to measure the success of product initiatives and iterate based on data-driven insights. 
Skills, Knowledge and ExpertiseRequirements: Proven Experience: at least 4 years of experience in product management, with a minimum of 1 year in a leadership role (huge plus if it’s within the SaaS or advertising technology industry). Strategic Thinker: strong strategic thinking and problem-solving skills, with a track record of shaping and executing product strategy that drive business growth. Team Leadership: demonstrated ability to lead, coach, and develop high-performing product teams. Customer-Centric: a deep commitment to understanding customer needs and delivering exceptional user experiences. Excellent Communication: exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to influence and inspire cross-functional teams. Doing what it takes: not being afraid to work side-by-side with Product Managers and their team to help them improve critical pieces of process or software. 
Nice to Have: Experience in Advertising Technology: familiarity with the digital advertising ecosystem, ad tracking, and campaign optimization tools. 
Benefits Understanding of performance marketing and affiliate marketingTotal compensation package comprised of base salary and variable pay (cash bonus and share options)Flexible working hoursTraining budget and pool of training daysOn-line training platform for everyonePrivate healthcareLife insuranceSport cardGame roomBirthday day offNAIS (benefit cafeteria with monthly bonuses)Additional 3 days off

job_description.21:
About the job
            
 
DescriptionAbout us:Pragmatic Play is a leading game developer providing player-favourites to the most successful global brands in the iGaming industry.Powering up new possibilities of play through one single API, Pragmatic Play offers a multi-product portfolio of award-winning slots, live casino, bingo, virtual sports, sportsbook and more, available in all major regulated markets, languages and currencies.Driven by a persistence to craft immersive experiences and responsible thrills, Pragmatic Play's global team consistently deliver best-in-class services with a dedication to create games that players love time and time again.Responsibilities: Produce successful Live Casino products for mobile, tablet and desktop and other platforms in Agile environment;Compose detailed and clear written specifications for new products and features;Define and communicate product vision together with teams of Developers, Designers, Testers, Studio team and other stakeholders;Work closely with Business Intelligence;Coordinate game production, setting daily, short-term and long-term goals and ensure game production proceeds according to schedule;Resolve product development issues, prioritizing product features;Support the Marketing, Business development and Account Management departments in their efforts to ensure revenue and customer satisfaction goals are met;Ensure new products and features are evaluated for usability and performance, employing focus group testing when necessary analyses trends in the gaming market and researching the market: products, customers, competitors, trends.
Requirements: At least 5 years of experience as a Product Owner with software development teams;Understanding of software development process;Excellent analytical skills;Ability to work with both established and newly formed teams, challenging and supporting them to continuously improve;Good remote work skills;Good record of driving and creating the product concepts and building outstanding solid solutions together with your teams;Able to work in fast moving, high pressure environment while maintaining accuracy and attention to detail;Excellent communication and interpersonal skills;Degree level or higher education;Fluent in English.
Other attributes we welcome: Experience in game development and /or online gaming;Previous experience in game design;Have a knowledge of casino games and game mathematics;Experience with online casino game marketing and promotions;Knowledge of regulatory compliance for gambling products.

job_description.31:
About the job
            
 
About our Client :Our client is a German Software Company. They are a team of developers, digitalization experts and data nerds from all over Europe who develop complex software projects.They are now looking for a Head of Product (f/d/m) to work at the intersection of product, marketing, and sales to drive one of their most successful products forward. The Head of Product (f/d/m) will lead a team of currently 6 employees across product and requirements management, marketing, and sales and will work closely with their founder and Managing Director. Further healthy growth of the team is planned for 2024.Your Role: Define and drive the product strategy in close partnership with the founder / CTO and the product, marketing, and sales teams.With your understanding of software development, you create a concise, effective, authentic product message that ensures a unique product positioning.Deriving an ambitious but also realistic product roadmap, which you actively pursue, implement and monitor using jointly defined KPIs.Responsible for effective marketing campaigns, you use market analyses, UX tests and the evaluation of customer feedback to improve the product continuously.Involved in new business processes with national and international clients.
Who you are:  You have in-depth experience shipping products that users love. You are an excellent communicator: able to rally a team around a goal, and effectively drive decisions where people might disagree.You are comfortable using qualitative data (e.g. user feedback) and quantitative data (e.g. metrics, analytics) to make decisions.You are motivated to grow and operate with autonomy in an often-unpredictable, tech environment.You have management experience but are still hands-on. You are a passionate product nerd with an exceptional understanding of technology — you develop what the customer really needs — and not what they think they need.You stand for unconventional approaches and excellence — with a fresh mindset and great communication skills.
Specifications:  10+ years of product management experience and demonstrated ability in a product manager role.An entrepreneurial / self-starter mindset who first and foremost knows how to get work done.Deep analytical, prioritization, and problem-solving skills.Excellent knowledge of software development lifecycles, processes, and methodologies. Clear and compelling in written and spoken communication in German and in English (business fluent). 
What our client offers:  100% remote work possible and flexible working time model.A diverse team of experts and a lot of creative freedom in a responsible role.A competitive salary with profit sharing.A company car is possible if desired.Continuous salary increases depending on success.
If you feel inspired and would like to take on a new challenge with our client, please feel free to apply for this job.#headofproduct #product #leadership #marketing #sales

job_description.36:
About the job
            
 
IntroductionStill haven’t found your dream job? Join team Huuuge!!Huuuge Games is a gaming company on a mission to build the world’s largest real-time casual gaming platform connecting millions of players so that they can have fun, socialize & play awesome games.Join Team Huuuge and become a part of an exciting adventure bringing pure fun & truly social experience to millions of players across the universe.As the Head of Slots Product, you will be at the forefront of crafting immersive gameplay experiences for our social casino slots. You will lead a team of passionate game designers, collaborating with artists, developers, and business stakeholders to create slots that captivate players and drive engagement.Responsibilities: Lead a team of game designers (math, audio, art, producers) to develop compelling gameplay mechanics, features, and systems for our social casino slots.Drive the conceptualization and design of game mechanics, user interfaces, levels, and progression systems to ensure an enjoyable and rewarding player experience.Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including artists, programmers, and producers, to bring game concepts to life.Participate in brainstorming sessions and contribute innovative ideas to enhance game features, monetization strategies, and player engagement.Analyze player feedback, metrics, and industry trends to iterate on game design, optimizing gameplay mechanics and features.Maintain a deep understanding of the social casino games market and competitors, identifying opportunities for differentiation and innovation.Take ownership of the game production process from concept to delivery, ensuring timely execution and adherence to project timelines.Possess excellent market and product knowledge with a deep understanding of our products and player base to tailor game development accordingly.Contribute to the continuous improvement of the game development process and adopt Agile/Scrum methodologies.
Requirements: 3+ years of experience in game design, with a demonstrated track record of contributing to successful online social casino games with slot preferenceProven experience in leading a team of game designers, providing mentorship and fostering a collaborative environment.Understanding of player psychology, engagement strategies, and monetization mechanics within the social casino games industry.Excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and present design concepts.A passion for gaming, staying up-to-date with industry trends, and a desire to push the boundaries of game designAn appreciation for mathematics and art and how they both influence game design.An impressive portfolio of slot games they taken to market with a large audience.A passion for casino and slot games, coupled with a keen eye for innovative gameplay mechanics.Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies is a plus, though not essential.

Requirements: 3+ years of experience in game design, with a demonstrated track record of contributing to successful online social casino games with slot preferenceProven experience in leading a team of game designers, providing mentorship and fostering a collaborative environment.Understanding of player psychology, engagement strategies, and monetization mechanics within the social casino games industry.Excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and present design concepts.A passion for gaming, staying up-to-date with industry trends, and a desire to push the boundaries of game designAn appreciation for mathematics and art and how they both influence game design.An impressive portfolio of slot games they taken to market with a large audience.A passion for casino and slot games, coupled with a keen eye for innovative gameplay mechanics.Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies is a plus, though not essential.

Über Tele Columbus AGWir sind einer der führenden Glasfasernetzbetreiber in Deutschland mit mehr als drei Millionen angeschlossenen Haushalten. Vorantreiben des Anforderungs- und Stakeholdermanagements für die zu verantworteten SoftwarekomponentenAnalyse der Business Anforderungen sowie Erkennen und Definieren der daraus resultierenden technischen ProduktanforderungenKommunikation der Stakeholderanforderungen an die Product-TeamsPriorisierung der Anforderungen in Abstimmung mit anderen POs anhand der UnternehmensprioritätetenErstellung von Epics und Stories in enger Zusammenarbeit mit dem Product-Team, den Architekt:innen und Stakeholder:innenKommunikation der zeitlichen Implikationen auf die Unternehmensroadmap an Management und Stakeholder:innenTreiben der Agilisierung mit fundierten Fachwissen und Fähigkeiten; Sichtbarmachen von Fortschritten und Projekterfolgen anhand von KPIs und ROI

job_description.49:
About the job
            
 
About us: Passion for food. Hunger for tech. We make METRO digital.Today technology is driving the world. And at METRO.digital we are driving the technology for one of the leading international wholesalers specializing in food - METRO. From e-commerce to checkout, to delivery software, we work on a wide range of products to make each day a success for our customers and colleagues. With passion and ownership, we build the future of wholesale – in 20+ countries. You are driving to create smart solutions for customers around the globe? You want to grow in a flexible environment? Let the right career opportunity find you and join us!How you will make an impact? As Domain Owner Web Experience, you will lead essential solutions and services for all the web touchpoints of METRO. Together with your team, you define and drive the strategy for high visibility of the METRO brand and guide customers to the different services and relevant offers leveraging personalized communication.You’ll head a team of Product Managers, Business Process Consultants and Domain Experts, responsible for eight multinational IT solutions in the area of customer.You'll collaborate in a cross-functional environment, engaging with internal engineering teams from different geographic regions, design teams, and external service providers to create customized products for diverse customer segments.Your Responsibilities: Steer and drive relevancy of our communication and offerings to customers in complex, international traffic environments;Partner with Business counterparts and country representatives to evangelize customer- centric development and lead related change processes to the required extent;Foster self-organizational skills in the product and service teams;Act as coach, coordinator, and in conflict situations, as moderator;Create an energizing environment and foster the development of individuals;Engage in active dialogue with stakeholders to communicate the value of and continuously develop domain solutions, report numbers, and explain potentials to grow;Deliver products based on business requirements and customer needs while balancing experimentation and Delivery;Activate domain solutions and strive for simpler structures about the harmonization and decommissioning of old solutions;Responsible for the Domain Budget and transparency on its consumption (efficient steering of resources across all service categories, etc.
Key competencies and qualifications: 10+ years of experience in digital product development environment(s);5+ years of experience in leading teams and developing people;Can-do solid attitude, inspiring personality with eagerness to continuously challenge the status quo to change things for the better;Proven track record in managing uncertainties, transforming (parts of) organizations and steer significant multi-stakeholder initiatives;Profound knowledge of web technology and common trends;Very assertive communication skills in English (written and verbal);Excellent interpersonal, organizational, and technical skills;Strong attention to details and technicalities.
What we offer at METRO.digital? Leave your footprint! Want to make a real difference to an enterprise and change how METRO communicates to millions of customers? This is your opportunity. We want and expect you to help us move faster, deliver better experiences and challenge beaten tracks.Flexible and remote work: create your own schedule! Flexibility defines the way we work and interact with each other. At METRO.digital you have the possibility to work remotely and adapt your working hours in a very flexible way.People development: when you grow so do we! We want you to become the best version of yourself with individual and company-wide programs and trainings for people development. Focused, among other, on development, leadership, appreciation…. it´s time to upskill your career.Support with individual solutions: we are people-caring! Life is full of surprises, full of challenges and we want to support you – whenever YOU need - at an individual level and during every stage of your life.

Together with your team, you define and drive the strategy for high visibility of the METRO brand and guide customers to the different services and relevant offers leveraging personalized communication.You’ll head a team of Product Managers, Business Process Consultants and Domain Experts, responsible for eight multinational IT solutions in the area of customer.You'll collaborate in a cross-functional environment, engaging with internal engineering teams from different geographic regions, design teams, and external service providers to create customized products for diverse customer segments.Your Responsibilities: Steer and drive relevancy of our communication and offerings to customers in complex, international traffic environments;Partner with Business counterparts and country representatives to evangelize customer- centric development and lead related change processes to the required extent;Foster self-organizational skills in the product and service teams;Act as coach, coordinator, and in conflict situations, as moderator;Create an energizing environment and foster the development of individuals;Engage in active dialogue with stakeholders to communicate the value of and continuously develop domain solutions, report numbers, and explain potentials to grow;Deliver products based on business requirements and customer needs while balancing experimentation and Delivery;Activate domain solutions and strive for simpler structures about the harmonization and decommissioning of old solutions;Responsible for the Domain Budget and transparency on its consumption (efficient steering of resources across all service categories, etc.
Key competencies and qualifications: 10+ years of experience in digital product development environment(s);5+ years of experience in leading teams and developing people;Can-do solid attitude, inspiring personality with eagerness to continuously challenge the status quo to change things for the better;Proven track record in managing uncertainties, transforming (parts of) organizations and steer significant multi-stakeholder initiatives;Profound knowledge of web technology and common trends;Very assertive communication skills in English (written and verbal);Excellent interpersonal, organizational, and technical skills;Strong attention to details and technicalities.
What we offer at METRO.digital? Leave your footprint! Want to make a real difference to an enterprise and change how METRO communicates to millions of customers? This is your opportunity. We want and expect you to help us move faster, deliver better experiences and challenge beaten tracks.Flexible and remote work: create your own schedule! Flexibility defines the way we work and interact with each other. At METRO.digital you have the possibility to work remotely and adapt your working hours in a very flexible way.People development: when you grow so do we! We want you to become the best version of yourself with individual and company-wide programs and trainings for people development. Focused, among other, on development, leadership, appreciation…. it´s time to upskill your career.Support with individual solutions: we are people-caring! Life is full of surprises, full of challenges and we want to support you – whenever YOU need - at an individual level and during every stage of your life.

job_description.57:
About the job
            
 
Project Description:The Product Owner is a key member of the product organization, who will help build the company's highest priority new product from initial functional requirements to launch.The role is responsible for understanding stakeholder requirements and successfully translate them into refined user-stories that will help the engineering team develop quality deliverables in every single sprint. Responsible for managing the product lifecycle and defining the unique value proposition that aligns with our company strategy while distinguishing our product among others. The Product Owner will be working closely with Senior and Principal Product owners within the Company and take their direction for strategy and priority.Responsibilities:• Provide direction to a development team to facilitate understanding of the business value and priority of tasks.• Work with Senior and Principal product owners to develop user stories and acceptance criteria.• Manage the product line technical life cycle.• Specify requirements in terms of functional requirements and objectives for current and future products.• Is part of the SCRUM team(s) that develop the product(s), not only defining requirements, but also being accountable for delivery, quality, robustness, and reliability of the product(s). Leads the team through influence.• Possess an appropriate sense of urgency to guarantee that the product will get to market on the expected/committed date, being able to motivate the team to accomplish the goal.• Manage the product backlog (grooming, prioritization, and refinement) and work day-to-day with the product teams to clarify requirements and accept final user stories.• Organize and prioritize bug resolution and day-to-day activities to maintain product(s) in a perfect operational shape.• Work with marketing, sales, and service on the development of product positioning, demo design, training courses, sales collateral, etc.• Collaborate with fellow Product Owners and other product team members.Mandatory Skills Description:• Bachelor's Degree required or equivalent in education and experience.• 3+ years of experience as a Product Owner with software for mission-critical products, working with Agile methodology (SCRUM). A background in component content management, document management, business process outsourcing and/or SaaS applications is highly desired.• 6+ years overall IT Experience.• Proven experience in customer development, product definition, feature scoping, and balancing tradeoffs for industry-leading business software products.• Some experience with creating/managing/delivering IaaS/SaaS/PaaS/Cloud products is a strong plus.• Some Project management experience necessary.• Strong organizational skills: ability to track and prioritize multiple issues.• Ability to adapt to changing situations and requirements.• Excellent oral, written communication, and presentation skills required.• Ability to communicate effectively with engineering teams.• Must be a strong collaborator, team player, and individual contributor.Nice-to-Have Skills:• CSPO title;• IPO (Initial Public Offering) understanding;• Capital Markets general knowledge.Languages:English: C1 Advanced

A background in component content management, document management, business process outsourcing and/or SaaS applications is highly desired.• 6+ years overall IT Experience.• Proven experience in customer development, product definition, feature scoping, and balancing tradeoffs for industry-leading business software products.• Some experience with creating/managing/delivering IaaS/SaaS/PaaS/Cloud products is a strong plus.• Some Project management experience necessary.• Strong organizational skills: ability to track and prioritize multiple issues.• Ability to adapt to changing situations and requirements.• Excellent oral, written communication, and presentation skills required.• Ability to communicate effectively with engineering teams.• Must be a strong collaborator, team player, and individual contributor.Nice-to-Have Skills:• CSPO title;• IPO (Initial Public Offering) understanding;• Capital Markets general knowledge.Languages:English: C1 Advanced
job_description.65:
About the job
            
 
We at Sastrify want to make our customers successful by helping them manage their SaaS tools and procure them in a fast and agile way.Sastrify supports Tech, Finance and Procurement teams in buying and renewing SaaS subscriptions so they can focus on what matters while we save their time and money by applying best practices in SaaS buying and using a dedicated procurement team that benefits from a large database of benchmarks.Sastrify recently achieved a significant milestone by securing a Series B funding round of $32 million. With a passion for excellence and a focus on continuous improvement, working at Sastrify is an exciting opportunity to contribute towards making our product even better.Join us on our new adventure to reshape the software-as-a-service industry!As our VP of Product (f/m/d) you will enable companies to do exactly that. This is a high-impact role in which you'll lead our Product Team, work closely with different stakeholders, engineers, designers and users. Therefore we are looking for a strong Head of Product who will drive our product to the next level.You'll be working with Max Messing, our CTO and Co-founderWhat you’ll do as our VP of Product (f/m/d) Foster team development by providing guidance, mentorship, and creating opportunities for growthDefine and communicate the product vision, ensuring alignment with the overall company strategyCultivate and maintain a product culture that values collaboration, continuous learning, innovation, and rapid testingTake ownership of key metrics and demonstrate a proven ability to drive their improvement Strategize and execute product roadmaps, taking into account customer discovery, product discovery, and modern product development processesEffectively manage stakeholders and prioritize requirements to deliver exceptional product outcomes Inspire and motivate the team, ensuring everyone is aligned and working towards shared goals
Requirements Proven experience as a Product Leader for previously scaled start-ups from Series A and beyondExcellent communication and leadership skills, with the ability to influence and inspire cross-functional teamsStrong background in road mapping and stakeholder management, with a track record of delivering successful productsDemonstrated ability to build and empower high-performing teamsPassion for hands-on work, utilizing an execution-focused and data-driven approachExpertise in modern product planning methodologies, customer discovery, and product development processesTrack record of creating a product cultureAdept at driving continuous testing, learning, and innovation, with a willingness to embrace and learn from mistakes. Ability to foster collaboration and mutual respect between designers, engineers, and the product teamPrevious experience in the SaaS industry is a plus, showcasing a deep understanding of its unique challenges and opportunities
Benefits Build strong technical and market expertise in the high-growing SaaS marketFull responsibility from day oneWork with our amazing international team (we have Sastronauts from 30+ different nationalities)Fully remote (you can work from anywhere)30 days of vacationFlexible working hoursLearning budgetState-of-the-art equipment and equipment budgetIn-person GatheringsVirtual team eventsMental health support
The Talent Acquisition Manager for this role is Elena Rudakova. Feel free to reach out to her with any questions!As an equal employment opportunity employer, Sastrify is committed to promoting an inclusive work environment. We want all of our employees to feel valued, appreciated, and free to be who they are at work, regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or veteran status.

Benefits Build strong technical and market expertise in the high-growing SaaS marketFull responsibility from day oneWork with our amazing international team (we have Sastronauts from 30+ different nationalities)Fully remote (you can work from anywhere)30 days of vacationFlexible working hoursLearning budgetState-of-the-art equipment and equipment budgetIn-person GatheringsVirtual team eventsMental health support
The Talent Acquisition Manager for this role is Elena Rudakova. Feel free to reach out to her with any questions!As an equal employment opportunity employer, Sastrify is committed to promoting an inclusive work environment. We want all of our employees to feel valued, appreciated, and free to be who they are at work, regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or veteran status.
job_description.75:
About the job
            
 
Our opportunity  Senior Product Owner – Global Digital Platforms – Global Digital Payments Are you ready to be at the forefront of digitalization in the insurance industry? Zurich Insurance is seeking a dynamic and innovative individual to join our team as Senior Product Owner for Global Digital Platforms. In this pivotal role, you will collaborate closely with our Business Units and Group functions to drive agile transformation and propel our digitalization efforts forward. Your role As a Senior Product Owner, your main tasks will involve:   Develop and manage the product roadmap for Global Digital Payments, ensuring alignment with business goals and user needs.  Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, and stakeholders, to ensure that the product meets business objectives and user needs.  Conduct market and competitive research to identify opportunities and gaps in the digital payment solutions market.  Define and prioritize product features and requirements based on user feedback, market research, and business goals.  Develop user stories, product backlogs, and acceptance criteria for development teams.  Participate in agile ceremonies, including sprint planning, backlog refinement, and sprint reviews.  Monitor and report on the product's performance, including user feedback, adoption rates, and revenue.  Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to develop go-to-market strategies and support product launches.  Own the 5 Ps of the Global Digital Payments solution.  Own the acquisition of Global Digital Payment business unit onboarding 
Your Skills And ExperienceAs a Senior Product Owner your skills and qualifications will ideally include:  Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.  5+ years of experience in product management, preferably in digital payment solutions.  Strong understanding of agile methodologies and product development lifecycles.  Deep understanding of the digital payments industry, digital payment solutions, including payment gateways, mobile payments, and e-wallets.  Strong analytical skills with the ability to gather and interpret data to drive product decisions.  Excellent communication and collaboration skills with cross-functional teams.  Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.  Strong leadership skills with the ability to motivate and influence team members.  Strong business acumen and demonstrated project acquisition experience  Excellent English skills 
 We offer Apart from monthly salary offer starting from 4 600 EUR/gross and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes:Working Time BenefitsPersonal days off, Concentrated work week, Additional vacation, Home office, Extra days off at occasion of childbirth, Sabbatical leave, WorkcationMonetary BenefitsLife insurance from Zurich Austria, Compensation for salary loss during sick leave, 3rd pension pillar contribution, Risk Life Insurance, Meal contribution on top of the legally required minimum, Years of service bonus, Wedding bonus, Baby bonusOther BenefitsEdenred electronic cafeteria, Public Transport contribution, Maternity leave benefits, Company and team events, Free parking at the office building, Massages in the officeLearning/DevelopmentProfessional Certifications, Online Education Portals, Extensive Onboarding program, Strengths based culture (GALLUP)  Location(s): Bratislava  Remote working: Yes (Slovakia based), usually we want to meet you once per week  Schedule: Full-time 
About UsAt our company, we recognize the importance of fostering an open-minded, safe and inclusive environment for everyone. We stand with diversity and respect different backgrounds and lifestyles. That's why we've implemented numerous initiatives to ensure our employees feel comfortable, accepted, and respected at all times.

job_description.82:
About the job
            
 
Project Description:The Product Owner is a key member of the product organization, who will help build the company's highest priority new product from initial functional requirements to launch.The role is responsible for understanding stakeholder requirements and successfully translate them into refined user-stories that will help the engineering team develop quality deliverables in every single sprint. Responsible for managing the product lifecycle and defining the unique value proposition that aligns with our company strategy while distinguishing our product among others. The Product Owner will be working closely with Senior and Principal Product owners within the Company and take their direction for strategy and priority.Responsibilities:• Provide direction to a development team to facilitate understanding of the business value and priority of tasks.• Work with Senior and Principal product owners to develop user stories and acceptance criteria.• Manage the product line technical life cycle.• Specify requirements in terms of functional requirements and objectives for current and future products.• Is part of the SCRUM team(s) that develop the product(s), not only defining requirements, but also being accountable for delivery, quality, robustness, and reliability of the product(s). Leads the team through influence.• Possess an appropriate sense of urgency to guarantee that the product will get to market on the expected/committed date, being able to motivate the team to accomplish the goal.• Manage the product backlog (grooming, prioritization, and refinement) and work day-to-day with the product teams to clarify requirements and accept final user stories.• Organize and prioritize bug resolution and day-to-day activities to maintain product(s) in a perfect operational shape.• Work with marketing, sales, and service on the development of product positioning, demo design, training courses, sales collateral, etc.• Collaborate with fellow Product Owners and other product team members.Mandatory Skills Description:• Bachelor's Degree required or equivalent in education and experience.• 3+ years of experience as a Product Owner with software for mission-critical products, working with Agile methodology (SCRUM). A background in component content management, document management, business process outsourcing and/or SaaS applications is highly desired.• 6+ years overall IT Experience• Proven experience in customer development, product definition, feature scoping, and balancing tradeoffs for industry-leading business software products• Some experience with creating/managing/delivering IaaS/SaaS/PaaS/Cloud products is a strong plus.• Some Project management experience necessary• Strong organizational skills: ability to track and prioritize multiple issues.• Ability to adapt to changing situations and requirements.• Excellent oral, written communication, and presentation skills required.• Ability to communicate effectively with engineering teams.• Must be a strong collaborator, team player, and individual contributor.

A background in component content management, document management, business process outsourcing and/or SaaS applications is highly desired.• 6+ years overall IT Experience• Proven experience in customer development, product definition, feature scoping, and balancing tradeoffs for industry-leading business software products• Some experience with creating/managing/delivering IaaS/SaaS/PaaS/Cloud products is a strong plus.• Some Project management experience necessary• Strong organizational skills: ability to track and prioritize multiple issues.• Ability to adapt to changing situations and requirements.• Excellent oral, written communication, and presentation skills required.• Ability to communicate effectively with engineering teams.• Must be a strong collaborator, team player, and individual contributor.

job_description.93:
About the job
            
 
Hľadáme talentovaného product ownera(ku), ktorý by chceli rozvíjať dátové riešenia a formovať budúcnosť najväčšej e-commerce platformy pre 160 miliónov nadšencov fitnessu v strednej a východnej Európe: GymBeam od vzniku robí všetky rozhodnutia na základe dát, čo z nás spravilo najrýchlejšie rastúcu fitness firmu v Európe;Dáta pripravuje 7-členný dátový tím, a chceme aby si v budúcnosti reporty pre svoje rozhodnutia robili kolegovia zo všetkých oddelení prevažne sami;Budeš pri definovaní a budovaní novej architektúry našej dátovej infraštruktúry a príprave nových dashboardov a reportov pre biznis.
ČO BUDE TVOJA PRÁCA: Budeš súčasťou dynamického tímu, ktorý sa venuje dátovým riešeniam pre celú firmu;Analyzovať príležitosti, navrhovať podobu dátových riešení, prioritizovať požiadavky od stakeholderov, a udržiavať roadmapu;Merať dopad nasadených riešení, formovať hypotézy, navrhovať a realizovať AB testy;Pomáhať juniornejšiemu Product Ownerovi s definovaním a realizáciou požiadaviek;Identifikovať a riešiť problémy s kvalitou, analyzovať príčiny častého výskytu bugov.
AKO SI ŤA PREDSTAVUJEME: Si skúsený produktový manažér alebo vlastník, a viedol si vývoj softvéru alebo dátových riešení v ecommerce, SaaS alebo softvérovej firme;Bol si zodpovedný za návrh komplexných funkcionalít alebo digitalizáciu procesov medzi oddeleniami;Máš výborné analytické myslenie a svoje rozhodnutia zakladáš na dátach;Máš skúsenosti s BI nástrojmi pre vizualizáciu dát;Vieš pochopiť potreby biznisu a pretlmočiť ich do technických požiadaviek pre vývojový tím;Dokážeš odprezentovať biznisu hodnotu ich dát a ukázať im ako nájdu v dátach odpovede na svoje otázky.
GYMBEAM TECHNOLOGICKÝ TÍM:  Na IT pracuje okolo 40 ľudí v 5 technologických tímoch;Softvérový vývojári, QA inžinieri, dátový inžinieri, produktový vlastníci;Technológie v dátovom tíme: Snowflake, Keboola, Python, AWS, GoodData
_________________________________________________________~ Mesačná mzda od 2600€ do 3800€ alebo faktúra od 165€ do 216€ na deň (platové ohodnotenie na základe zručností a skúseností)~ Nástup ihneď~ TPP alebo živnosť~ Práca na diaľku (alebo kancelárie v Košiciach, Bratislave a Prahe)

AKO SI ŤA PREDSTAVUJEME: Si skúsený produktový manažér alebo vlastník, a viedol si vývoj softvéru alebo dátových riešení v ecommerce, SaaS alebo softvérovej firme;Bol si zodpovedný za návrh komplexných funkcionalít alebo digitalizáciu procesov medzi oddeleniami;Máš výborné analytické myslenie a svoje rozhodnutia zakladáš na dátach;Máš skúsenosti s BI nástrojmi pre vizualizáciu dát;Vieš pochopiť potreby biznisu a pretlmočiť ich do technických požiadaviek pre vývojový tím;Dokážeš odprezentovať biznisu hodnotu ich dát a ukázať im ako nájdu v dátach odpovede na svoje otázky.
GYMBEAM TECHNOLOGICKÝ TÍM:  Na IT pracuje okolo 40 ľudí v 5 technologických tímoch;Softvérový vývojári, QA inžinieri, dátový inžinieri, produktový vlastníci;Technológie v dátovom tíme: Snowflake, Keboola, Python, AWS, GoodData
_________________________________________________________~ Mesačná mzda od 2600€ do 3800€ alebo faktúra od 165€ do 216€ na deň (platové ohodnotenie na základe zručností a skúseností)~ Nástup ihneď~ TPP alebo živnosť~ Práca na diaľku (alebo kancelárie v Košiciach, Bratislave a Prahe)

job_description.108:
About the job
            
 
In This Role, You Will Own the strategic direction, product planning, and execution for the App Platform TrackUnderstand the needs and challenges of our customers, other tracks, and departmentsBuild a flexible platform, a foundation for our multi-product strategy with seamless and user-friendly UI/UX that is scalable, customizable, and efficientManage all key product metrics, monitor performance, and report on product healthCollaborate with engineering teams to enhance and develop the platform to enable our customers and other tracksFacilitate training for internal teams to ensure product knowledge and understanding across the organizationConduct competitive analysis to stay ahead of market trends and developments
About You 5+ years of experience in Product Management, preferably with a focus on SaaS platforms and enterprise customersStrong technical backgroundDemonstrated experience working with developer personas and managing products catered to this audienceProven track record in creating, launching, and growing productsExcellent communication, leadership, and stakeholder management skillsAbility to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and drive change across cross-functional teamsAbility to manage multiple competing priorities simultaneouslyScrum & Agile-based B2B SaaS product management/ownership experienceCan work independently with minimal directionAble to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneouslyStrong interpersonal and communication skillsFluent English (verbal and written)
Company OverviewPandaDoc empowers more than 50,000 growing organizations to thrive by taking the work out of document workflow. PandaDoc provides an all-in-one document workflow automation platform that helps fast scaling teams accelerate the ability to create, manage, and sign digital documents including proposals, quotes, contracts, and more. For more information, please visit https://www.pandadoc.com.Company CultureWe're known for our work-life balance, kind co-workers, & creative virtual team-bonding events. And although our Pandas are located across the globe, we stay connected with the help of technology and ensure that everyone on our team feels, well, like a team.Pandas work best when they're happy. We retain our talent by upholding our values of integrity & transparency, and selling a product that changes the lives of our customers.Check out our LinkedIn to learn more.Benefits An honest, open culture that emphasizes feedback and promotes professional and personal developmentAn opportunity to work from anywhere — our team is distributed worldwide, from Lisbon to Manila, from Florida to California6 self care daysA competitive salaryAnd much more!
PandaDoc is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to equal treatment of all employees without regard to race, national origin, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, veteran status, physical or mental disability or other basis protected by law.EXTERNAL RECRUITERSApproval RequirementThe use of external recruiters/staffing agencies requires prior approval from our HR Team. The HR Team at PandaDoc requests that external recruiters/staffing agencies not to contact PandaDoc employees directly in an attempt to present candidates. Complying with this request will be a factor in determining future professional relationships with PandaDoc.

And although our Pandas are located across the globe, we stay connected with the help of technology and ensure that everyone on our team feels, well, like a team.Pandas work best when they're happy. We retain our talent by upholding our values of integrity & transparency, and selling a product that changes the lives of our customers.Check out our LinkedIn to learn more.Benefits An honest, open culture that emphasizes feedback and promotes professional and personal developmentAn opportunity to work from anywhere — our team is distributed worldwide, from Lisbon to Manila, from Florida to California6 self care daysA competitive salaryAnd much more!
PandaDoc is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to equal treatment of all employees without regard to race, national origin, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, veteran status, physical or mental disability or other basis protected by law.EXTERNAL RECRUITERSApproval RequirementThe use of external recruiters/staffing agencies requires prior approval from our HR Team. The HR Team at PandaDoc requests that external recruiters/staffing agencies not to contact PandaDoc employees directly in an attempt to present candidates. Complying with this request will be a factor in determining future professional relationships with PandaDoc.

job_description.118:
About the job
            
 
Department: ProductEmployment Type: Full TimeLocation:  Kraków, PolandReporting To: Aleksander FronczekCompensation: zł20,000 - zł25,000 / monthDescriptionAbout the role: Head of Product - ZeroparkCommerce Media Tech is seeking an experienced and strategic-minded Head of Product to join our dynamic team - Zeropark. In this pivotal role, you will play a crucial part in defining and executing our product strategy for Zeropark, leading and mentoring a team of product manager, product designer and UX researcher to better meet the evolving needs of our customers. It is the highest product role in Zeropark, so you will also become part of the Zeropark management crew.About Company:Commerce Media Tech is a Kraków based ad-tech company, responsible for creating innovative software for effective online advertising. Together with brilliant software engineers, UX designers, project managers, marketing teams, and many other talented specialists, we provide technology, support, and education to digital marketers looking for new ways to reach their goals.Zeropark, the first of many products owned by Commerce Media Tech, is a self-serve performance marketing platform for brands, agencies, and media buyers. Our services include both incremental advertising and online traffic monetization solutions, as well as cutting-edge technology for programmatic ad serving.Key Responsibilities Product Strategy: develop and articulate a clear and compelling product vision and strategy for Zeropark, aligning it with Commerce Media Tech's overall direction. Team Leadership: lead, mentor, and inspire a team of product people, fostering a culture of user-centricity, collaboration, and continuous improvement (currently you would work directly with one PM, one designer and one researcher). Execution: drive the successful execution of the product roadmap, ensuring the timely delivery of high-quality value for our customers. Market Research: stay abreast of industry trends, competitive landscape, and customer feedback to identify opportunities for product improvements and innovation. Customer Focus: develop a deep understanding of customer needs and pain points, working closely with cross-functional teams to prioritize and deliver solutions that provide exceptional value. Cross-Functional Collaboration: build collaboration process with engineering, design, marketing, and other departments to ensure alignment and successful product launches. Product Analytics: define and track key product metrics to measure the success of product initiatives and iterate based on data-driven insights. 
Requirements Proven Experience: at least 4 years of experience in product management, with a minimum of 1 year in a leadership role ( plus if it’s within the market advertising technology industry). Strategic Thinker: strong strategic thinking and problem-solving skills, with a track record of shaping and executing product strategy that drive business growth. Team Leadership: demonstrated ability to lead, coach, and develop high-performing product teams. Customer-Centric: a deep commitment to understanding customer needs and delivering exceptional user experiences. Excellent Communication: exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to influence and inspire cross-functional teams. Doing what it takes: not being afraid to work side-by-side with Product Managers and their team to help them improve critical pieces of process or software. 
Nice to Have: Experience in Advertising Technology: familiarity with the digital advertising ecosystem, ad tracking, and campaign optimization tools. 
What we offer Total compensation package comprised of base salary and variable pay (cash bonus and share options)Flexible working hoursTraining budget and pool of training daysOn-line training platform for everyonePrivate healthcareLife insuranceSport cardGame roomBirthday day offNAIS (benefit cafeteria with monthly bonuses)Additional 3 days off

job_description.124:
About the job
            
 
Als Product Owner gestalten Sie aktiv die Entwicklung und Optimierung unseres internen Tools ILVM (Intelligentes Lieferanten- & Vertragsmanagement) mit. Sie sind der Schlüsselansprechpartner für Geschäftsprozesse und Digitalisierung.Aufgaben: Verantwortung für die Weiterentwicklung von ILVM in enger Zusammenarbeit mit Stakeholdern und Entwicklerteams.Definition von Produktanforderungen und Steuerung des Projekts von Anfang bis Ende.Fachliche Steuerung von Teams und/oder externen Dienstleistern.Durchführung von Workshops zur Prozessoptimierung.Kontinuierliche Marktbeobachtung und Integration neuer Technologien.Enge Zusammenarbeit mit internen und externen Entwicklern sowie Stakeholdern.Koordination von Release-Zyklen und Vermarktung des Tools.
Qualifikation: Abgeschlossenes Studium oder Ausbildung in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder vergleichbare Qualifikation.Mehrjährige Erfahrung als Product Owner oder in der Produktentwicklung.Fundierte Kenntnisse im Bereich ServiceNow oder vergleichbaren Plattformen.Prozessanalyse- und optimierungsfähigkeiten.Erfahrung in der Zusammenarbeit mit Entwicklerteams und im Stakeholder-Management.Konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten und klare Kommunikation.Betriebswirtschaftliche Kenntnisse.Teamfähigkeit, Kommunikationsstärke und Eigeninitiative.Sehr gute Deutsch- & Englischkenntnisse.

Sie sind der Schlüsselansprechpartner für Geschäftsprozesse und Digitalisierung.Aufgaben: Verantwortung für die Weiterentwicklung von ILVM in enger Zusammenarbeit mit Stakeholdern und Entwicklerteams.Definition von Produktanforderungen und Steuerung des Projekts von Anfang bis Ende.Fachliche Steuerung von Teams und/oder externen Dienstleistern.Durchführung von Workshops zur Prozessoptimierung.Kontinuierliche Marktbeobachtung und Integration neuer Technologien.Enge Zusammenarbeit mit internen und externen Entwicklern sowie Stakeholdern.Koordination von Release-Zyklen und Vermarktung des Tools.

job_description.138:
About the job
            
 
Who is the Client?Ocho have partnered exclusively for this role with one of Ireland's leading Finance SaaS organisations who are rapidly scaling. Our client has engineered cutting-edge software solutions for accounting and practice management. Their team comprises top-tier talent, ready to spearhead the industry with an exceptional cloud software offering.Our client genuinely has a world class team who have developeed outstanding software that empowers businesses by allowing them to build their processes around their software platform and accelerate scaling and best practice implementation.What is the Opportunity?As the Head of Product, your role is pivotal in ensuring sustained commercial success and driving product revenue growth. This involves formulating a robust product strategy encompassing our client's accounting software portfolio and relevant partner products, including the identification of new partners aligning with commercial and market needs.What will be your responsibilities?Market Analysis:Conduct comprehensive market sector analysis, covering competitor profiling, win/loss price and pricing reviews, NIHITO visits, customer advisory boards, sentiment analysis, and tracking market trends.Effectively communicate relevant data and conclusions to stakeholders.Internal Communication and Engagement:Proactively engage internal stakeholders, ensuring their active participation in product strategy development and keeping them informed of any changes or issues.Coordinate with product managers and teams in charge of other areas to maintain a unified approach.Roadmap and Release Strategy:Develop and communicate a well-defined product roadmap and release strategy based on market and competitor trends, giving priority to customer requirements.Go-To-Market Activities:Drive GTM activities, encompassing internal positioning, pricing targets, total addressable market analysis, competitor updates, product marketing, and external positioning through various channels.Product Performance and Analysis:Monitor and analyse product pricing, commercial KPIs, discount analysis, market sector P&L, and product line analysis.Document market requirements and establish high-level requirements for the next version of the product.Regular Communication:Provide regular progress updates internally and externally, communicate changes to roadmap plans, and address any internal issues.Key Deliverables & KPIsMarket sector product vision, strategy, targets, and KPIs.12-month product roadmap with clear alignment with strategy and vision.Product pricing, monitoring, and commercial KPIs for market sector product performance.High-level requirements for the next version of the product.GTM plan for the successful launch of products and services to market.Regular communication updates on progress, roadmap plans, and any internal issues.RelationshipsCollaborate closely with engineering teams, commercial managers, other product managers, sales and pre-sales teams, customer services, and partners to ensure a cohesive approach and support across all functions.Skills & KnowledgeClear commercial acumen with a focus on building strategic product revenue.Proficient in product management and commercial ownership.Strong planning, presentation, problem-solving, and analytical skills.Excellent communication and written English skills.Proficient use of Microsoft applications.ExperienceMinimum 2 years leading a product team and 5 years of prior experience in the relevant product area.In-depth knowledge of the accounting market with a strong background in accounting software.This opportunity will be a chance to take your career to the next level using best-in-class technologies. For more information, contact Aaron Somers via LinkedIn or hit the apply button, and they can have a confidential chat about this or any other roles they may have.

Our client has engineered cutting-edge software solutions for accounting and practice management. Their team comprises top-tier talent, ready to spearhead the industry with an exceptional cloud software offering.Our client genuinely has a world class team who have developeed outstanding software that empowers businesses by allowing them to build their processes around their software platform and accelerate scaling and best practice implementation.What is the Opportunity?As the Head of Product, your role is pivotal in ensuring sustained commercial success and driving product revenue growth. This involves formulating a robust product strategy encompassing our client's accounting software portfolio and relevant partner products, including the identification of new partners aligning with commercial and market needs.What will be your responsibilities?Market Analysis:Conduct comprehensive market sector analysis, covering competitor profiling, win/loss price and pricing reviews, NIHITO visits, customer advisory boards, sentiment analysis, and tracking market trends.Effectively communicate relevant data and conclusions to stakeholders.Internal Communication and Engagement:Proactively engage internal stakeholders, ensuring their active participation in product strategy development and keeping them informed of any changes or issues.Coordinate with product managers and teams in charge of other areas to maintain a unified approach.Roadmap and Release Strategy:Develop and communicate a well-defined product roadmap and release strategy based on market and competitor trends, giving priority to customer requirements.Go-To-Market Activities:Drive GTM activities, encompassing internal positioning, pricing targets, total addressable market analysis, competitor updates, product marketing, and external positioning through various channels.Product Performance and Analysis:Monitor and analyse product pricing, commercial KPIs, discount analysis, market sector P&L, and product line analysis.Document market requirements and establish high-level requirements for the next version of the product.Regular Communication:Provide regular progress updates internally and externally, communicate changes to roadmap plans, and address any internal issues.Key Deliverables & KPIsMarket sector product vision, strategy, targets, and KPIs.12-month product roadmap with clear alignment with strategy and vision.Product pricing, monitoring, and commercial KPIs for market sector product performance.High-level requirements for the next version of the product.GTM plan for the successful launch of products and services to market.Regular communication updates on progress, roadmap plans, and any internal issues.RelationshipsCollaborate closely with engineering teams, commercial managers, other product managers, sales and pre-sales teams, customer services, and partners to ensure a cohesive approach and support across all functions.Skills & KnowledgeClear commercial acumen with a focus on building strategic product revenue.Proficient in product management and commercial ownership.Strong planning, presentation, problem-solving, and analytical skills.Excellent communication and written English skills.Proficient use of Microsoft applications.ExperienceMinimum 2 years leading a product team and 5 years of prior experience in the relevant product area.In-depth knowledge of the accounting market with a strong background in accounting software.This opportunity will be a chance to take your career to the next level using best-in-class technologies. For more information, contact Aaron Somers via LinkedIn or hit the apply button, and they can have a confidential chat about this or any other roles they may have.

job_description.144:
About the job
            
 
Company DescriptionAt Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of €1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let’s fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.  Job Description  Strategizing and presenting ideas to stakeholders.Defining product features according to customer needs.Leading the development process.Acting as the main point of contact between teams and stakeholders.Managing and prioritizing product backlog items.Assisting the scrum/product development team to meet the objectives of each sprint.Adjusting and improving each iteration of the product before release.Keeping customers and stakeholders informed of the status of the product.Create the items in the backlog of the feature team, build the release planning and communicate on the progression.
  Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree in the IT area or equivalent.Minimum 5 years of experience as Product Owner.Minimum 2 years of experience in agile methodology.Analytical and synthetical mind.Working knowledge of agile methodology, techniques, and frameworks, such as Scrum or Kanban, to deliver solutions.Leadership and management experience.Experience with Agile Scrum, project tasking tools (e.g., JIRA, Asana).Experience working with project tasking tools (e.g., JIRA ).Fluency in English essential.

job_description.153:
About the job
            
 
About Copado:Copado is the #1 DevOps Platform for Salesforce and the Cloud. We harness the power of native CI/CD and Robotic Testing to drive digital transformation for 1,000+ of the most innovative brands on the planet — from Coca-Cola to eBay to Volkswagen. Our low-code platform unites non-technical admins and pro-code developers on the same system and empowers enterprises to scale end-to-end software delivery across multi-cloud environments.The impact on your business? 20X faster releases, 94% fewer production bugs and 46% more Salesforce ROI. The impact on your team? No more late nights, weekend war rooms or stressful release days.Role Overview:As a Product Operations Director at Copado, you'll play a critical role in supporting and optimizing our product management processes. This position focuses on operational efficiency, incorporating customer feedback into product development, and ensuring seamless product lifecycle management.Please note: we can consider applicants who are located in Chicago, Helsinki, Amsterdam or Madrid.What you'll do: Feedback Integration: Collaborate with Sales Engineers, Technical Account Managers, Customer Success Managers, and Professional Services to integrate customer feedback into product improvements.Product Scorecard and KPI Management: Develop, manage, and track key performance indicators for product performancePartner with Product Leadership to ensure top-level department objectives can be measured via department scorecardsTrack programs, projects, funding, and applications & features so that the performance and predictability of the product creation flow can be planned and managed effectively, based on data.Bring enhancements to the usage conventions and functions of Copado Plan to support Product and EngineeringOperationalize Product Planning Communications: Ensure effective communication of product roadmaps, releases, updates, and enablement across teamsProgram Management of Product Rollouts: Coordinate the rollout of new product features and updates, ensuring cross-departmental collaboration and successful execution.
Your Deliverables: Streamlined Product Operations: Establish and refine operational processes to enhance product development and lifecycle management.Effective Communication Channels: Develop robust communication strategies for sharing product updates and roadmaps internally.Operationalize: IDEAS and Roadmap Communications
Copado is Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Copado does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Copado will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Copado.

job_description.157:
About the job
            
 
The RoleAs a Product Owner Sustainability, you will play a pivotal role in enriching our value proposition and service offerings by introducing innovative solutions to control and reduce carbon emissions. Your responsibilities will include conducting lifecycle assessments of our products and services, establishing sustainability and carbon management practices within B2X, and collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to drive the design, development, and implementation of sustainable solutions.Key Job Responsibilities Conduct lifecycle assessments of products and services.Represent and establish sustainability and carbon management within B2X.Stay informed about innovations, funding opportunities, and regulations related to sustainability, PCF, etc.Collaborate as a subject matter expert with Sales, IT, and Operations to implement sustainability and carbon solutions.Exchange knowledge and actively network within the industry, participating in CSR events.
The PersonWe are looking for an ambitious individual with the right attitude and work ethic to help us move the business and our sustainability solutions forward. Degree focusing on sustainability (university or comparable qualification in environmental or sustainability management).Experience with sustainability assessment methodologies, particularly Company or Product Carbon Footprints.Experience in developing and implementing group-wide, holistic sustainability strategies is advantageous.Excellent written and spoken English.
What we offer: Home-office-based position and flexible working hours, with frequent travel for team and customer meetings.Versatile responsibilities influencing crucial decisions at the heart of the company.Multicultural operating environment.Open-minded, positive, and motivated atmosphere with flat hierarchies and short decision paths.Independence and responsibility to contribute your talents to a forward-thinking team.
Are you interested? Join us in driving sustainable innovation and make a significant impact on the future with B2X. Apply today to be a part of our dynamic team!Contact: Katarzyna Pawlowska (katarzyna.pawlowska@b2x.com) Human Resources B2X

job_description.161:
About the job
            
 
About RevolutPeople deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of aweso﻿me products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 35+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.  As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. We've been officially certified as a Great Place to Work™ in recognition of our outstanding employee experience! So far, we have 7,500+﻿ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.About The RoleOur Technology team isn’t just one of the best in the industry, it’s one of the best in the world. And we’re proud of it. It’s our driving force; our engine 🚀 From building a new banking backend to creating an award-winning app, there’s nothing (and we mean nothing) our tech team can’t do.Our Technology team isn’t here to fix legacy systems – it’s here to build world-class financial products from the ground up. Products that will be used by millions of people around the world (18+ million people, not that we’re counting) 🌎We’re looking for a Head of Engineering who knows how to build excellent engineering teams 💎Someone who can combine providing technical oversight and leadership to major projects with acting as a functional manager. Great communicator and partner, who will enjoy working closely with our Product Owners and Business Heads 👋Up for the challenge? Get in touch 👇What You’ll Be Doing Owning the product and solution architecture with a key focus on quality control and code optimisation Influencing best practices, and helping to ensure these are followed across the company Optimising and reviewing the performance of teams, with an aim to increase the quality of engineering as a functional leader Closely involving with our hiring process
What You'll Need Bachelor's Degree (or above) in Computer Science/Maths/Physics/similarExperience building and leading a significant software engineering team(s) within a scaling organisationStrong software architecture skillsHands on experience with JVM languagesExperience building and scaling high achieving engineering teamsBig picture thinking - correctly diagnosing problems and building innovative solutionsExcellent communication and collaboration skills to partner closely with Product Owners and Business Heads
Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.Refer to our Data Privacy Statement for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.
